        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Loads the given file as a Properties file, and assigns it to a builder.

        For details on the possible configurations, please refer to the configuration API.

        Specified by:
        fromPropertiesFile in interface ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Parameters:
        file - The file to load. Must exist, must be a file, must not be null.
        Returns:
        The builder to continue configuration with, with the properties from the given file loaded. Never null.

      • inMemoryDatabase

        public ChronoDBInMemoryBuilder inMemoryDatabase()
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate an in-memory ChronoDB.

        In-memory databases behave in the same way as regular ones, but are not persistent, i.e. their contents will be gone when the JVM shuts down, or the garbage collector reclaims their memory.

        Specified by:
        inMemoryDatabase in interface ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Returns:
        The builder to continue configuration with. Never null.

      • mapDbDatabase

        public ChronoDBMapDBBuilder mapDbDatabase(java.io.File file)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a process-embedded, MapDB -based ChronoDB.
        Specified by:
        mapDbDatabase in interface ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Parameters:
        file - The file to write the data into. Must not be null. Must point to an existing, accessible file.
        Returns:
        The new builder to continue configuration with. Never null.

      • tuplDatabase

        public ChronoDBTuplBuilder tuplDatabase(java.io.File file)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a process-embedded, TUPL-based ChronoDB.
        Specified by:
        tuplDatabase in interface ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Parameters:
        file - The file to use as the "base path" for TUPL. All relevant data will be located in files that have the path of the given file as prefix. Must point to an existing, accessible file.
        Returns:
        The new builder to continue configuration with. Never null.

      • chunkedDatabase

        public ChronoDBChunkedBuilder chunkedDatabase(java.io.File file)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a process-embedded, chunked ChronoDB.

        A chunked ChronoDB organizes the data in chunks and is capable of performing rollover operations that allow for larger histories to be managed effectively.

        Specified by:
        chunkedDatabase in interface ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Parameters:
        file - The base file where data is stored. Please note that this database backend will create several files and folders next to the given base file; it is recommended to have a folder that contains nothing else than this base file. Must not be null, must point to an existing, accessible file.
        Returns:
        The new builder to continue configuration with. Never null.

      • embeddedDatabase

        public ChronoDBMapDBBuilder embeddedDatabase(java.io.File file)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a process-embedded, file-based ChronoDB.
        Specified by:
        embeddedDatabase in interface ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Parameters:
        file - The directory to write the DB data into. Must not be null, must point to a directory (not a file).
        Returns:
        The builder to continue configuration with. Never null.

      • jdbcDatabase

        public ChronoDBJdbcBuilder jdbcDatabase(java.lang.String jdbcConnectionURL)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Creates a builder that is configured to instantiate a ChronoDB that writes its contents to the SQL database at the given JDBC connection URL.
        Specified by:
        jdbcDatabase in interface ChronoDBBaseBuilder
        Parameters:
        jdbcConnectionURL - The JDBC connection URL to connect to. Must not be null, must be a valid JDBC URL.
        Returns:
        The builder to continue configuration with. Never null.
